title: Arizona woman wanted for February shooting, also charged with January shooting: reports
description: Phoenix, Arizona police arrested a woman on Friday who was wanted in Mesa, Arizona as a suspect in a fatal shooting, and later linked to an earlier fatal shooting in Phoenix.

title: Michael Lerner, 'Barton Fink' actor, dead at 81
description: Oscar-nominated star Michael Lerner died Saturday at 81. He was known for "Eight Men Out," "Godzilla," and TV roles, including "Clueless," "Courthouse" and "Glee."

title: Jon Rahm wins Masters as strong Sunday helps him outlast Brooks Koepka
description: Jon Rahm stayed strong through his Sunday marathon to secure the 87th Masters at Augusta National Golf Club for his first career green jacket.

title: Iran installs cameras to crack down on women not wearing hijab
description: Iran has started installing cameras in public places so that authorities can rein women who aren't wearing their hijabs in violation of the country's religious laws.

title: Crime reporter's viral TikTok video shares what to do if you are home alone: 'Don't get quiet, make noise'
description: News on 6 crime reporter Lori Fullbright shares what you should and should not do if you are home alone and someone knocks on your door in a viral TikTok video.

title: Odell Beckham Jr agrees to deal with Ravens after missing 2022 season recovering from Super Bowl injury
description: Odell Beckham Jr. will be playing for the Baltimore Ravens during the 2023 season as he appeared to announce his deal with the team on social media.

title: NASCAR star Kyle Larson ahead of Bristol race: 'We don’t need to be racing on dirt'
description: NASCAR champion Kyle Larson didn't appear to be too happy with having to race on dirt at Bristol as he gets ready to start the race on the pole.

title: 'Super Mario Bros. Movie' breaks 2023 box office records
description: The animated film from Universal adapted from the video game garnered $146 million over the weekend, with another $173 million in international earnings.

title: Oregon paper laments homeless crisis, high taxes, violence driving citizens to other states
description: A newspaper from Oregon lamented that people are moving away from the state and its most famous city by the thousands, theorizing on some of the chief reasons.

title: Timberwolves' Jaden McDaniels punches wall, injures hand moments after Rudy Gobert punched teammate
description: Things are not going well for the Minnesota Timberwolves in their final regular-season game against the New Orleans Pelicans on Sunday.

title: Delaware duo arrested for allegedly murdering man in March: police
description: Delaware State Police arrested a man and a woman on Saturday for allegedly shooting and killing a man during the early morning hours on March 19.

title: Sahith Theegala nails incredible chip-in for birdie at Masters
description: Sahith Theegala finished the first Masters tournament of his career on Sunday and had an epic moment in the fourth round of the event.

title: Northern Ireland police disrupt alleged New IRA bomb plot ahead of Biden's visit: report
description: The Police Service of Northern Ireland reportedly disrupted a bomb plot by members of the New IRA ahead of a visit by President Joe Biden next week.

title: Rudy Gobert punches Timberwolves teammate during timeout, gets sent home
description: The Minnesota Timberwolves sent Rudy Gobert home after he punched teammate Kyle Anderson during a timeout in the final regular-season game against the New Orleans Pelicans.

title: Washington state crews responding to boat fire in Tacoma Tideflats, residents receive smoke warning
description: Multiple agencies are responding to a fire that broke out aboard the Kodiak Enterprise Saturday, prompting officials to issue a warning for surrounding residents.

title: Spurs' Gregg Popovich makes plea for tighter gun control, likens Second Amendment to 'myth'
description: San Antonio Spurs coach Gregg Popovich used his pregame press conference to call for tighter gun measures, call out Republican lawmakers and dismiss the Second Amendment.

title: King Charles' coronation details revealed
description: Coronation plans for King Charles and Queen Consort were announced by Buckingham Palace on Easter. Armed forces will salute royals in parade post ceremony.

title: Los Angeles suspect throws puppy out of moving car during police chase
description: An 8-week-old mixed-breed puppy was thrown in a Michael Kors bag and tossed onto the street during a police chase in Los Angeles on Friday, culminating in three arrests, the LAPD said.

title: California driver, 13, charged in deadly vehicle crash involving stolen vehicle
description: A 13-year-old California boy is accused of stealing a car and leading police on a chase before colliding with other vehicles, killing one person and injuring nearly a dozen others.

title: Massachusetts man found dead on side of Cohasset road: police
description: Massachusetts police officials found a 40-year-old deceased man on the side of a road in the seaside town. Detectives and state troopers are investigating the incident.

title: Chicago police find two bodies near O’Hare Airport hours apart
description: Chicago Police Department (CPD) officials reported that they found two dead bodies hours apart near O’Hare International Airport on Saturday. They believe one was an overdose death.

title: HHS Secretary says Biden administration ignoring federal judge’s abortion pill ruling is ‘on the table’
description: HHS secretary Xavier Becerra condemned the ruling against an abortion pill on Sunday, warning that all manner of options are being considered to combat it.

title: Colorado Home Depot customer gets attacked by dog, owner flees store
description: A Home Depot shopper in Evergreen, Colorado, was bitten in the face by a dog after the dog owner approached them and asked them to give the canine a treat as part of its training.

title: Benches clear in White Sox-Pirates game after scary collision leaves Oneil Cruz with broken ankle
description: Pittsburgh Pirates shortstop Oneil Cruz suffered a broken ankle in a scary home-plate collision against the Chicago White Sox, which led to a benches-clearing scuffle.

title: Woman with tuberculosis faces jail and forced treatment after she refused isolation and visited a casino
description: An unidentified woman in Washington state who was diagnosed with tuberculosis was found in contempt of court after refusing to isolate and pursue treatment despite warnings.

title: Pastor spends Easter in jail after another arrest at drag queen event
description: Canadian pastor Derek Reimer, 36, was arrested for the third time in five weeks and spent Easter weekend behind bars after protesting a drag queen story time for children.

title: Royal family attends first Easter service since Queen Elizabeth’s death
description: The royal family stepped out together to celebrate their first Easter service since the passing of Queen Elizabeth II last year.

title: Israel Adesanya gives iconic celebration after knocking out Alex Pereira to win back UFC belt
description: Israel Adesanya called it "sweet revenge" when he knocked out Alex Pereira to win the middleweight belt back at UFC 287 on Saturday night in Miami.

title: China conducts second day of military drills around Taiwan, simulates strikes on the island
description: Several dozen Chinese military aircraft and nine naval vessels conducted military exercises around Taiwan and simulated strikes on the island on Sunday.

title: French Alps avalanche kills four hikers, injures others
description: An avalanche near the ski resort of Contamines-Montjoie in the French Alps killed at least four people and injured others Sunday afternoon, officials say.

title: Dolphins' Tyreek Hill left in the dust by young football player at Miami camp
description: Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill was giving back to the youth with his football camp in Miami on Saturday, but he didn't expect one camper to embarrass him on the field.

title: Imam stabbed during prayers at New Jersey Omar Mosque: reports
description: A prayer leader, known as an imam, was stabbed twice Sunday at a mosque in Paterson, New Jersey. The suspect's name has not been released, nor a motive.

title: Social media secret profiles: Does Facebook have your info?
description: If you use social media, it's worth clearing out all the things you've looked up. Here are easy steps to save yourself some potential embarrassment later.

title: Senate chaplain doubles down after saying 'thoughts and prayers' are not enough after Nashville shooting
description: Senate Chaplain the Rev. Barry Black said there is "a time when action is required" after calls from Democrats to reintroduce gun control legislation after Nashville school shooting.

title: Florida police arrest third juvenile suspect in triple homicide
description: The Marion County, Florida sheriff's office, with the help of U.S. Marshals and the Lake County Sheriff's Office arrested a third suspect in connection to a triple homicide.

title: Gov. Gavin Newsom offers DeSantis political advice, says he will get 'rolled by Trump': 'Pack up and wait'
description: Gov. Gavin Newsom offered Gov. Ron DeSantis some political advice during an interview on Sunday and said he would get "rolled" by Donald Trump in an election.

title: Soros-backed policy group notches victory with Biden's transgender Title IX rules
description: A group bankrolled with nearly $10 million from a George Soros nonprofit notched a victory from the Biden administration's proposed Title IX rule, which brings in gender identity.

title: Former AG issues chilling warning that left's agenda is 'leading to horrific crimes'
description: Former acting U.S. Attorney General Matthew Whitaker shared his concerns for the left's push for gun control amid rising crime.

title: LSU star Angel Reese receives support from Tony Yayo, creator of 'You Can't See Me' taunt
description: LSU star Angel Reese received support from the originator of the "You Can't See Me" taunt in the wake of the backlash she received from doing the celebratory gestures.

title: Dem senator accuses Trump of leaving Biden with ‘bad options’ for disastrous Afghanistan withdrawal
description: Sen. Ben Cardin appeared on "FOX News Sunday" and said that President Biden was not left with any good options concerning the Afghanistan withdrawal in 2021 because of Trump.

title: UFC star praises Trump, DeSantis, leads crowd in ‘Let’s go, Brandon' chant
description: UFC Star Jorge Masvidal praised former President Trump and Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis after the final fight of his career, going on to lead a 'Let's go, Brandon' chant.

title: 'Fox News Sunday' on April 9, 2023
description: This week on 'Fox News Sunday,' host Shannon Bream welcomed Sen. Ben Cardin, Sen. Lindsey Graham, and more to discuss the week's top political headlines.

title: Julian Assange's family grills government's 'over-classification' of documents: 'A problem for democracy'
description: Julian Assange's father and brother defended his actions of leaking military information during a recent appearance on Fox Nation's 'Piers Morgan: Uncensored.'

title: Trump attorney pushes back after NBC host asks if Trump is holding classified docs for payout: 'Cheap shot'
description: James Trusty, an attorney representing Donald Trump, called accusations that Trump was looking for a financial settlement over classified documents a "cheap shot."

title: Leaked Pentagon documents claim Israel’s Mossad encouraged protests against Netanyahu
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the Mossad denied reports Sunday that Israel's intelligence agency had encouraged protests against Netanyahu's judicial reform efforts.

title: CNN presses Rep. Ocasio-Cortez over claims Biden admin should 'ignore' abortion ruling: 'Stunning position'
description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez was pressed by CNN's Dana Bash on Sunday about her call for the Biden administration to ignore the ruling on the abortion pill.

title: Barr slams Trump as weak candidate, makes bold prediction for 2024 election
description: Former Attorney General Bill Barr said he views former President Trump as the "weakest of the Republican candidates," expecting him to lose to President Biden in the 2024 general election.

title: Religious liberty nonprofit blasts bill banning protests near drag shows: 'Deranged parody of public law'
description: Liberty Coalition Canada founder Michael Thiessen blasted a recent provincial bill in Ontario that would criminalize protests and "offensive remarks" around drag shows.

title: Two Florida women arrested after taunting, abusing elderly woman on live stream 'pieces of crap,' sheriff says
description: Two healthcare workers in Florida have been arrested after allegedly taunting, abusing an elderly woman with dementia and live streaming it, Sheriff Wayne Ivey says.

title: Lindsey Graham lambasts Biden White House's review of botched Afghanistan exodus: 'Political white-wash'
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C. grilled the Biden administration's report on the Afghanistan withdrawal Sunday, criticizing claims that Trump created conditions for the catastrophe.

title: AOC claims there is 'crime wave' within GOP after saying officials should ignore court rulings
description: New York Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez argued there is a crime wave within the Republican Party, and cited Trump and Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas.

title: Norfolk Southern train cars derail, spilling diesel and oil; 2 taken to hospital
description: Two crew members were briefly hospitalized after a Norfolk Southern train derailed in Alabama on Easter Sunday. Officials say there is no hazardous materials threat.

title: Five empty Norfolk Southern train cars derail in Pittsburgh
description: It was not immediately clear what caused five empty Norfolk Southern train cars to derail in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, on Saturday. No injuries were reported.

title: Jim Nantz appears to make LIV Golf crack as Brooks Koepka finishes up third round of Masters
description: Jim Nantz appeared to make a LIV Golf joke at the expense of Brooks Koepka on Sunday as players finished up the third round of the Masters.

title: Missouri boy delivers hundreds of Easter baskets to children in need: 'Helping kids smile'
description: Since he was three years old, Luke Flerlage has been volunteering with Alleluia Baskets in O'Fallon, Missouri, providing Easter baskets for the under privileged community.

title: Sprint car driver Justin Owen, 26, dies from injuries suffered in crash at track
description: The U.S. Auto Club on Sunday announced Justin Owen died from the injuries he suffered in a crash at an Indiana racetrack on Saturday night.

title: Louisville's Hailey Van Lith enters transfer portal after tournament run
description: Louisville women's basketball star Hailey Van Lith announced she will transfer from the school after three stellar years playing for the Cardinals.

title: Body discovered in submerged car of Florida teacher missing since 2020, sheriff says
description: A body was discovered inside a vehicle that belongs to Robert Heikka, a teacher in Port Orange, Florida, who went missing in 2020, after the car was pulled from a canal.

title: Police are using invasive facial recognition software to put every American in a perpetual lineup
description: AI tech company Clearview AI is coming under fire after providing facial recognition software to law enforcement agencies, private companies and other organizations.

title: Former drug dealer on mission to prevent overdose deaths after harrowing past: Rebellion ‘led me to crime'
description: Former drug dealer Pancho Mercado shares the metamorphic moment that he decided to leave a life of crime, making it his mission to save lives.

title: 2 arrested in Isle of Palms shooting police say began with high school ‘skip day’
description: Police have arrested two teenagers in relation to an Isle of Palms shooting in South Carolina that left six people injured, most of them high schoolers, on Friday.

title: NASCAR legend Cale Yarborough 'is not doing well': report
description: Cale Yarborough is in need of prayers as he is "not doing well," according to John Dodson, the vice president of business alliances and NASCAR at Universal Technical Institute.

title: Jonas Brothers say they don't give each other parenting advice: 'Unspoken Rule'
description: The Jonas Brothers revealed they avoid giving each other parenting advice, saying it is an "unspoken rule" between the three as the brothers continue to grow their musical careers and families.

title: GOP rep. raises questions, calls for investigation into leaked US documents: 'It's a huge deal'
description: Rep. Brad Wenstrup, R-Ohio, raises questions concerning the leaking of classified U.S. intelligence and stresses the need to investigate.

title: Riley Gaines rejects SFSU's statement suggesting students protested 'peacefully': 'I was assaulted'
description: Riley Gaines reacted to an email sent to San Francisco State University students after protests erupted at an event Gaines spoke at on campus on Saturday.

title: One of America’s top tourist destinations ranked as least neighborly city in country
description: Miami, Florida, is the least neighborly city in America, according to an AmeriCorps study, with veterans and people with kids taking top spots for informally helping.

title: Report on Clarence Thomas' travel habits is 'politics plain and simple': expert
description: Calls for the resignation of Justice Clarence Thomas are unfounded, an expert told Fox News Digital, and there is no "there there" when it comes to a report on his travels.

title: Soros-backed DA behind Army veteran's murder conviction accused of witness tampering, withholding evidence
description: Texas Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick, R., criticized Soros-backed DA Jose Garza for bringing charges against an Army veteran who allegedly acted in self-defense against a BLM rioter.

title: Never forget another appointment again with this ultimate scheduling tech
description: Kurt "CyberGuy" Knutsson explains how to add and customize events in your iPhone or Android calendars so that you will never miss another appointment again.

title: Rumer Willis says Bruce Willis, Demi Moore are 'so excited' over first grandchild, offering plenty of advice
description: Bruce Willis and Demi Moore's daughter, Rumer, shared how both her parents are "so excited" to welcome their first grandchild after Rumer announced the news back in December.

title: Los Angeles LGBT Center to host drag queen march Easter Sunday
description: Los Angeles LGBT Center plans to host a drag march, Easter Sunday, to protest legislation that protects children from drag performances and gender reassignment surgery.
